books.title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
books.author: Eric Carle
books.name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
books.synopsis: The Very Hungry Caterpillar is a children's picture book by Eric Carle. The story follows the journey of a hungry caterpillar as it eats its way through various foods and transforms into a beautiful butterfly.

books.title: Where the Wild Things Are
books.author: Maurice Sendak
books.name: Where the Wild Things Are
books.synopsis: Where the Wild Things Are is a children's picture book by Maurice Sendak. The story follows the adventures of a young boy named Max as he travels to a land of wild creatures and becomes their king.

books.title: Green Eggs and Ham
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.name: Green Eggs and Ham
books.synopsis: Green Eggs and Ham is a children's book by Dr. Seuss. The story features a persistent character who tries to convince a hesitant friend to try green eggs and ham.

books.title: The Giving Tree
books.author: Shel Silverstein
books.name: The Giving Tree
books.synopsis: The Giving Tree is a children's picture book by Shel Silverstein. The story follows the relationship between a tree and a boy, and the tree's selfless giving of itself to the boy over the years.

books.title: Goodnight Moon
books.author: Margaret Wise Brown
books.name: Goodnight Moon
books.synopsis: Goodnight Moon is a children's picture book by Margaret Wise Brown. The book features a series of goodnight wishes for familiar objects and goodnight greetings for people and animals.

books.title: The Little Engine That Could
books.author: Watty Piper
books.name: The Little Engine That Could
books.synopsis: The Little Engine That Could is a children's picture book by Watty Piper. The story follows a little engine that overcomes obstacles and learns to believe in itself.

books.title: Oh, the Places You'll Go!
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.name: Oh, the Places You'll Go!
books.synopsis: Oh, the Places You'll Go! is a children's book by Dr. Seuss. The story offers encouragement and inspiration for life's journey, encouraging readers to embrace challenges and opportunities.
